== Table of Contents ==
To insert a Table of Contents paste this :
<pre>
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right; font-size: 0.9em; width:40%; background:#FFEFD5; margin: 0 0 1em 1em;" style="padding:0.5em;">'''Contents'''<nowiki>[[BR]]</nowiki><nowiki>[[TableOfContents]]</nowiki>
|}
</pre>
{i} note : background color is `papaya whip`

== Text Formatting ==
{i} see HelpOnFormatting

=== Italics, Bold, Bold Italics ... ===
<pre>
''this is italics''
'''this is bold'''
'''''this is bold italics'''''
</pre>
gives :                        <<BR>>
''this is italics''            <<BR>>
'''this is bold'''             <<BR>>
'''''this is bold italics''''' 

=== Mixing Bold & Italics ===
<pre>
'''''The 1st'' Example'''
'''The 2nd'' Example'''''
'''''The 3rd''' Example''
''The 4th''' Example'''''
</pre>
gives :                   <<BR>>
'''''The 1st'' Example''' <<BR>>
'''The 2nd'' Example''''' <<BR>>
'''''The 3rd''' Example'' <<BR>>
''The 4th''' Example'''''

=== Underline, superscript and subscript ===
<pre>
__notice the double underscores__
^superscript^ and ,,subscript,,
</pre>
gives :                           <<BR>>
__notice the double underscores__ <<BR>>
^superscript^ and ,,subscript,,

=== Font adjustment ===
<pre>
you might need to write ~-smaller-~ or ~+bigger+~ 
</pre>
gives : <<BR>>
you might need to write ~-smaller-~ or ~+bigger+~ 

=== Showing code ===
<pre>
this is <code>inline</code> code because markers are on the same line
otherwise you get a box just like the ones all over the page (monospace font)
</pre>
gives : <<BR>>
this is <code>inline</code> code because markers are on the same line <<BR>>
otherwise you get a box just like the ones all over the page (monospace font)

<pre>
you can also get `inline` code using backticks
</pre>
gives : <<BR>>
you can also get `inline` code using backticks

=== Paragraphs ===
<pre>
paragraph1,
hello this is paragraph1, use <nowiki>[[BR]]</nowiki>
to go on next line, have an empty line <nowiki>[[BR]]</nowiki>
to separate two paragraphs...

paragraph2,
hello this is paragraph2, to make an horizontal
ruler, use ----
</pre>
gives : <<BR>>
paragraph1,
hello this is paragraph1, use <<BR>>
to go on next line, have an empty line <<BR>>
to separate two paragraphs...

paragraph2,
hello this is paragraph2, to make an horizontal
ruler, use ----

=== Titles ===
<pre>
== title 1 ==
=== title 2 ===
==== title 3 ====
===== and so on... =====
</pre>
gives :
== title 1 ==
=== title 2 ===
==== title 3 ====
===== and so on... =====

----

== Code Formatting ==
{i} see HelpOnParsers

=== example using cplusplus parser ===
<pre>
# !cplusplus start=42 step=0 numbering=on
int main(a,b,c){
  return (a+b+c)*0 + 42;
}
</pre>
gives (the space at the beginning was removed) :
{{{#!cplusplus start=42 step=0 numbering=on
int main(a,b,c){
  return (a+b+c)*0 + 42;
}
}}}
